LOCAL AND FOREIGN LOANS : DETAILS 1432/07 4.

( ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayaka) , , , (3) :

() (i) 2006 2007 ; (ii) ; (iii) ; ? () (i) ; (ii) ; ? () , ?

, , : () (i) 2006 2007 , ? (ii) ? (iii) ? ? () (i) ? (ii) ? ? () , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order: (a) Will he submit to this House separately (i) the amounts of money obtained as local and foreign loans in the years 2006 and 2007;

(ii) on the basis of each loan, the state and the institution from which the aforesaid loans were obtained ; and (iii) the rates of interest paid in respect of the aforesaid loans? (b) Will he state separately (i) the purposes for which each of the aforesaid loans was obtained ; and (ii) the specified repayment period, the annual installment and the interest in respect of each loan; (c) If not, why?

( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) , , , , * . . * : : Answer tabled: () (i) 2006 2007

asked the Minister of Transport,:

(a) Will he state

(i) whether the depot managers, assistant managers, and mobile managers who were employed in the SLTB depots in Gampaha, Welisara, Divulapitiya, Ja-Ela, Kadawatha, Kirindiwela and Negombo in the Gampaha District have been employed in services that are lower than their regular services; and

(ii) if they have been employed in such services, their names and the designations they held, and their present designations?

(b) Will he inform this House separately the reasons for employing the aforesaid employees in grades lower than their regular services?

(c) Will he admit that Sri Lanka Transport Board has caused an injustice to aforesaid employees by employing them in that manner?

(d) If so, will he take action to rectify it immediately and reinstate them in their regular services?

(e) If not, why?

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order: (a) Will he inform this House (i) the amount of money that has been allocated under the Gama Neguma / Gemi Isura programme, to the Suriyawewa Divisional Secretarys Division for the year 2007; (ii) if the relevant Divisional Secretariat Division has received the aforesaid amount of money, the date of receipt; and (iii) if not, the date on which the aforesaid amount of money would be received? (b) Will he submit to this House separately, in each of the projects (i) the development activities that are intended to be carried out using the aforesaid monies; (ii) the name of the Grama Niladhari Division/ village in which those activities would be carried out; (iii) the estimated amount, the date of commencement, and the date on which it is expected to be completed; and (iv) the amount of money that has been released for the proposals on which the work has already been commenced? (c) Will he inform this House (i) the activities for which the involvement of the councilors / members of local government bodies are obtained in implementing these projects; (ii) the criteria on which they are selected; and (iii) their names? (d) Will he inform this House as to how the involvement of the relevant councilors / members is considered legal under the laws pertaining to the subject of Local Government and Provincial Councils? (e) if not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) , , , , * . * : : Answer tabled :

: : / LUNUGAMWEHERA DIVISIONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION : GAMA NEGUMA / GEMI ISURA

1368/'07 2. ( )

( - - ) (The Hon. Nihal Galappaththi on behalf of The Hon. Vijitha Ranaweera) , , , (2) : () (i) 2007 / ;

(ii) , ; (iii) , ; ? () (i) ; (ii) / ; (iii) , , ; (iv) ; ? () (i) / ; (ii) ; (iii) ; ? () / ? () , ? , , : () (i) 2007 / , (ii) ,

2008 19 1443 1444

() (i) / , (ii) , (iii) , ? () / () , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order, (a) Will he inform this House (i) the amount of money that has been allocated under the Gama Neguma / Gemi Isura programme, to the Lunugamwehera Divisional Secretarys Division for the year 2007; (ii) if the relevant Divisional Secretariat Division has received the aforesaid amount of money, the date of receipt; and (iii) if not, the date on which the aforesaid amount of money would be received? (b) Will he submit to this House separately, in each of the projects (i) the development activities that are intended to be carried out using the aforesaid monies; (ii) the name of the Grama Niladhari Division / village in which those activities would be carried out; (iii) the estimated amount, the date of commencement, the date on which it is expected to be completed; and (iv) the amount of money that has been released for the proposals on which the work has already been commenced? (c) Will he inform this House (i) the activities for which the involvement of the councilors / members of local government bodies are obtained in implementing these projects; (ii) the criteria on which they are selected; (iii) their names?

(d) Will he inform this House as to how the involvement of the relevant councilors / members is considered legal under the laws pertaining to the subject of Local Government and Provincial Councils? (e) if not, why?

. ( . ) (The Hon. R. Sampanthan) Sir, I am on my feet and I want to be heard. I do not want another Member to budge in when I am on my feet. ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . . . ( . ) (The Hon. R. Sampanthan) I think that is not correct. We had nominated Mr. Ma-yadunne and I believe you and the other parties too agreed with the nomination. If there was some matter that His Excellency the President wished to raise in regard to that nomination, he should have communicated it to you. You could have summoned us and told us, There is a problem here. How can we sort it out? We would have sorted out the prob-lem for you. We would have summoned Mr. Mayadunne and told him, There seems to be a problem of this nature. How can we sort it out? The matter could have been sorted out. That was not done. That being pracitised is the proper procedure. But here speeches are being made in Parliament by various Members who have nothing to do with the nomination, who have no right to speak about the nomination and they are trying to explain as to why things have not been done when what was required to be done. If there was some clarification, some matter to be looked into, that should have been done through proper channels adopting the proper procedure. Coming to Par-liament, standing up here and making speeches and trying to explain to the country as to why Mr. Mayadunne has not been nominated is not the answer. We would strongly urge, Sir, that the nomination be made and if there is some matter to be looked into, you communicate that to us and then we will deal with the matter. 1473 1474

[..11.26] ( )

( () - , ) (The Hon. (Prof.) Tissa Vitharana - Minister of Science and Technology) , . . On the dawn of this year, we saw the tragic loss of a fellow Member of Parliament, the Hon. Thiagarasah Maheswaran. I, at the outset, would like on behalf of the Lanka Samasamaja Party to express our deepest condolences to his wife, three children, other family members and also to the party that he represented, the United National Party. The late Hon. T. Maheswaran was an outspoken defender of the rights of the Tamil people. He sought election from Jaffna and was successfully elected as a Member of a national party, the United National Party. From that time onwards, he steadfastly served to win the interests of the Tamil people. He was under pressure while he was in Jaffna. That compelled him later to enter Parliament from the Colombo District. But while he represented the Colombo District in Parliament under the UNP, he continued to espouse the cause and the interests of the Tamil people in the North, particularly in Jaffna. So, we have to recognize the invaluable role he played. He was a young, dynamic Member of Parliament and a successful businessman. Through his business, he was instrumental in transporting goods that were necessary for the people of Jaffna, thereby contributing to the welfare of those people. We have to appreciate it. That role, he played with determination. He was an outspoken critic of those he felt wronged the Tamil people. On certain matters, we may not agree with what he said, but he had the complete right to do so and we must recognize the fact that he did so with conviction, giving priority to the interests of the Tamil people. The issue regarding his death is not yet solved. I must mention that the previous speaker from the Opposition raised the question of DNA testing. The DNA testing has been done and I am sure that eventually those who are guilty will be found. We have to realize that this killing and various other killings resulted due to the situation of conflict that our country faces. There are killings which can be attributed to various identifiable forces in our country, but, at the same time, there are killings which are being carried out by a third force, which is interested in promoting the conflict and making money out of it. So, let us wait and see what the final outcome would be. But, let us also bear in mind on this occasion when we are remembering our fellow Member of Parliament, that what is really needed is the resolution of the conflict; every effort should be made to resolve this conflict to bring

about a permanent solution to the national question and achieve lasting peace. On my part I can say that through the All Party Representative Committee, we are striving to achieve that objective and I hope that eventually we would be able to show that the death of our Comrade, the Hon. Maheswaran, has not been in vain. Thank you. [.. 11.32] ( ) (The Hon. Subscription : The annual subscription for Official Report of Hansard is Rs. 2,178. A single copy of Hansard is available for Rs. 18.15. (Postage Rs. 2.50) Copies can be obtained by remitting in advance an annual subscription fee to the SUPERINTENDENT, GOVERNMENT PUBLICATION BUREAU, No. 132, Maya Avenue, Kirulapone, Colombo 5. The fee should reach him on or before November 30 each year . Late application for subscriptions will not be accepted.
